intro: Lysimachia pyramidalis, commonly known as upright loosestrife, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features upright, branching stems covered in small, opposite leaves that are usually oval to lance-shaped. Its showy, yellowish-green flowers are clustered in terminal spikes, blooming in late spring to early summer. Lysimachia pyramidalis is often used in ornamental gardening for its attractive foliage and floral display.
